data.field_of_research: Oncology and Carcinogenesis not elsewhere classified
data.source_system: Cancer disparities exist between rural and metropolitan patients. Inferior survival outcomes are reported for rural residents, which can amount to a 7% difference in 5-year survival proportions. Factors implicated include: socio-economic disadvantage, limited access to specialist services, later diagnosis, and poorer treatment. Little is known about the decision-making process of patients. This research project examines patients� preferences for cancer treatment, and whether there are differences depending on geographical location.
